text: I’m posting this on the random channel as well, mainly because so few people have subscribed to the hardware channel…

attachments.fallback: [March 24th, 2021 10:42 AM] karen.archer: I’m about to buy a new computer, I’m interested in the general consensus regarding whether to go intel or amd?   And at what level?  My current plan is to go with a 10th gen i9, although I’m not sure what the price point of the 11th gen will be.  My reasons for going for intel over one of the ryzens is that intel is better suited for numerical computation with the MKL etc.  Is that the case?

attachments.title: JuliaLang
attachments.text: This is the Zulip server for the Julia programming language community. We ask anyone joining to adhere to the Julia Code of Conduct. | To learn more about Julia, check out <https://julialang.org/>, or just come ask us here! | You can reach out to the admins of this Zulip by sending a direct message to @zulip-admins.

elements.text: There are quite a few Zulip threads on this, e.g.

text: In general if you search around for "Laptop", "CPU", "Intel" etc. you'll find quite a few discussions on the merits of different processors, GPUs and other hardware specifically for numerical work
